case_vignette: A 54-year-old man is brought to the physician by his wife because of progressive difficulty walking during the past 3 months. He has not been able to walk without assistance for the past month and has started to use a wheelchair. He also reports having urinary incontinence for 1 year. His wife says that he has begun to slur his words and has become very difficult to understand. His temperature is 37.0°C (98.6°F), pulse is 70/min, and respirations are 16/min. His blood pressure is 130/80mm Hg while sitting and 110/65mm Hg when standing. He is oriented to person and place but not to time. Neurological examination shows a mild tremor in his right hand and rigidity in his upper and lower extremities. He is unable to perform repetitive rotary forearm movements.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having progressive difficulty walking over the past 3 months and can't walk without help now, using a wheelchair. I've also had problems controlling my bladder for a year.
How old are you and what is your sex?
I am a 54-year-old man.
Have you experienced any changes in your vision or eye pain?
No, I haven't experienced any changes in my vision or eye pain.
Do you have any numbness, tingling, or weakness in your arms or hands?
No, I haven't mentioned any numbness, tingling, or weakness in my arms or hands.
Do you have any difficulties with balance or coordination, apart from the walking difficulties?
I haven't specifically mentioned balance or coordination issues apart from my walking difficulties.
Have you had any problems with speech, swallowing, or changes in your cognition?
Yes, I've started to slur my words and have become very difficult to understand.
Have you experienced any muscle stiffness or spasms?
I have rigidity in my arms and legs.
Do you have a personal or family history of neurological disorders?
I haven't mentioned any personal or family history of neurological disorders.
Have you been following any specific medication regime for these symptoms or any other medical condition?
I haven't mentioned taking any medications for these symptoms or any other conditions.
**Final Diagnosis:** Primary Lateral Sclerosis (PLS)
